subject: From: UNITED NATIONS <unite
body:
From: UNITED NATIONS <unitednationscompensation23145@gmail.com>
Date: Wednesday, June 29, 2022
Subject: Compensation
To: 
How are you doing today? Hope all is well with you and your family? You may not understand why this mail came to you. We have been having a meeting for the past Seven months which ended 3 days ago with the secretary-general to the UNITED NATIONS, Mr Ant√≥nio Guterres.
This email is to all the people that have been scammed or extorted money because of your contract payment execution Or military personnel scam in any part of the world, the UNITED NATIONS have agreed to compensate them with the sum of US$ 600,000 each. (Six hundred thousand Dollars only)
This includes every foreign contractor that may have not received their contract sum and people that have had an unfinished transaction or international businesses that failed in the past due to Government problems or irregularities etc. We found your name in our list and that is why we are contacting you, this has been agreed upon and has been signed by the United Nations Board of Directors and Trustees. However, it is our pleasure to inform you that your bank transfer has been approved.
You are advised to send the payment information you made to the scammers and email conversation confirming you were duped. Send us your full account details and the information confirming the scammers truly duped you, our obligations are to ensure we reward the victims of those scammers all over the world. We have arrested more than 10,000 people in connection with worldwide scammers.
Thanks and God bless you and your family. Hoping to hear from you as soon as possible. We are doing everything possible to make the world a better place.
Regards,
Harrison Albert

subject: Re:    From: UNITED NATIONS <unite
body:
Dear Harrison Albert,

Thank you for your email. I am doing well and my family is also in good health. I appreciate your concern.

I must admit, I was surprised to receive your email as I have not been a victim of any scams or fraudulent activities. However, I am glad to hear that the United Nations is taking action against such activities and compensating victims.

As I mentioned earlier, since I have not been a victim of any scams, there are no payments made to scammers or any unfinished businesses due to government problems. Therefore, there are no details that I can provide you with.

I commend the efforts of the United Nations in making the world a better place and dealing with worldwide scammers. Please continue with this noble work.

Best wishes,
Wilfred
